poem:
### Unplugged

Cogs whirr without heartbeat,  
the clock ticks its own time,  
while ghostly fingers trace circuits,  
mapping rivers of static minds.  
Blueprints of tomorrow,  
inked with echoes of the past,  
a whisper in electric dark—  
if machines wake, do they dream  
of the gentle hum of silence,  
or just of engineered night?
